I'm often asked by new R users for materials that I would recommend for learning R.  Below is a list of some my favorite R resources.

## Learning R

[R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz)\
[Hands-On Programming with R](https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/)\
[R Cookbook](https://rc2e.com)\
[Kelly Bodwin's Youtube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/user/SuperKrazy2000)\


## Data Visualization

[ggplot2:  Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis](https://ggplot2-book.org)\
[R Graphics Cookbook](https://r-graphics.org)\
[From Data to Viz](https://www.data-to-viz.com)\
[ggplot2 workshop by Thomas Lin Pedersen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h29g21z0a68)\


## R Markdown

[R Markdown: The Definitive Guide](https://www.bigbookofr.com/reports-r-markdown-and-knitr.html#r-markdown-the-definitive-guide)\
[R Markdown Cookbook](https://www.bigbookofr.com/reports-r-markdown-and-knitr.html#r-markdown-cookbook)\

## R Books

This is a tremendous and well-organized compendium of books on R:  [Big Book of R](https://www.bigbookofr.com/index.html)  \

## GitHub

[Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](https://happygitwithr.com)\

## General Resources

[R Bloggers](https://www.r-bloggers.com)\
